text:
Alright. Are you guys ready
for your first challenge?

-Absolutely!
-Let's do it.

Ludo is going to show you how
he makes an American classic.
Eggs Benedict.
Oh, boy.
Let's go, Ludo!
[ Speaks French ]
[ Speaks in French ]
Voilà.
[ Speaking in French]
What?

I guess none of you
speak French.

Negative.
I don't know
what you're saying.

I'm not going
to lie to you.

Ludo just explained
Napoleon's life story.
[ Laughter ]

You do know you can buy
hollandaise in a jar, right?
Oh! [ Gags ]
You're kidding, right?

So, voilà, the texture
of the hollandaise, okay?
Ah, c'est magnifique!
[ Speaking in French]

I have never made
eggs Benedict before,

and honestly,
I'm a little bit nervous.
I do not speak French.

This is definitely going to be
a difficult challenge.
[ Speaking in French ]

-Yes, Chef.
-Voilà, guys.
Okay, that's eggs Benedict.

Challenge number one,
follow the Ludo.

You're going to need
to work together

to make three different
portions of eggs Benedict.
$20,000 on the line.
35 minutes.
Get it? Got it? Go!
Teams of two! Teams of two!
I have no formal training.

I would love to work
with someone who does.

So, okay.
We are on the same side,
okay?

-Perfect. Perfect.
-Okay.

I'm going to make the eggs
and the hollandaise.

We -- We could make little
roasted sweet potatoes...

I'm down with that.
...like in cubes.

Sure.
And a fennel
with orange salad.

That sounds fantastic.
Okay. Let's do that?

Let's go.
Yeah, let's get set.

Jackie and I are going to be
making an eggs Benedict

but add some smoked
salmon to it.

I'm feeling really
good about it.

We're keeping it fairly simple,
which feels like a win for me.

I was like thinking
like side potatoes

and maybe like
some macerated berries

or something like that
on the side?

That sounds good.
Yeah.

Coby and I are totally
on the same page.

We're both picturing
a classic brunch plate.

Sides. Let's talk about
the sides real fast.

We'll do like
a vegetable fritter
and some sort of potato...

Hash with like peppers
and onions?
Yeah.

We're going to do
an eggs Benedict with salmon.
I am going to follow her lead

and let her make
the big decisions,
and then just try to help.
Vinegar.

Not vodka.
Oh, my God.

There's so many
different buttons.
[ Laughs ]

I think that I probably took on
the weakest link in the chain.

Can you help me
with my buttons? Thanks.

Jackie: Oh, can you
make them like smaller?
Smaller?

Yeah. Because we don't
have too much time.

I'm worried
about these sauces, Ludo.

I explained to them
in good French.

[ Laughs ]
So, they should be okay.

That's just not
going to cook.

What isn't?
That.

Why don't you
put that in a pan?

What was that?
Your potatoes.

That's not going
to cook in the oven.

I'm just going off of
what I was told. I don't know.

Rats.
Make sure you
make them small

so they get cooked
all the way through.
Rats!

I'm putting my potatoes
in a skillet

because that's going
to brown them quicker
and cook them faster.

But Ben's putting those
in the oven.
Eh, not so sure about that.
This is a nightmare.

I need you to get
one of your bowls

that fit in here that
doesn't touch the water,

and I need you
to put six yolks in them.

Egg yolks.
Egg yolks. That's it. Hurry up.

My biggest mistake
right now is assuming

Mallory knew her way
around the kitchen

the way she knows her way
around a bottle of vodka.
My bad.
What'd you do?

I didn't put
no shells in there.

That's a lot of white!
Stop!

-No whites.
-Come on, Mallory.

Your sauce won't set up
with whites in it.

The trouble is, I can't tell
if it's intentional
or if it's incompetence.
Let's do a backup.

Something like another backup,
a side dish.

If somebody
screws something up,

we can slip it in there
and fix it.

Okay.
You know what I'm saying?
Oh. [ Indistinct ] No!
There's too much water.

Now we need to add
brown sugar, paprika,
salt and pepper to that.

I already put salt
and pepper.
Alright, cool.

She don't know
what she's doing over there.
[Bleep] me.
Okay. [Bleep] Alright.

Relax, Chastity.
Alright.

I can't relax. I have to still
make the hollandaise.

Do you need help
with that hollandaise?
I don't know, man.

I need to make
another vegetable fritter.
I got a lot of shit to do.
15 minutes left!

That's rude.
That's burning.
[Bleep] It is!

Aye!
I can't make the hollandaise.
[ Sighs ] [Bleep]
